text: hello my needle drops Anthony Fantan oh
here internets busiest music nerd review
time hot chips Hot Chip in our heads
these guys are an English synth pop band
with a strong emphasis on hooks and
dance beats this is their fifth
full-length LP it's self produced and
out on Domino Records they've never
really been one of my favorite bands in
this style of music but I've always been
impressed with the amount of homework
that Hot Chip clearly does and has done
when it comes to their genre
they'll be futzing around with a lot of
analogs since on some of their tracks
and and the way these sequence them to
will really call back to the golden days
of synthesizer pop groups like OMD
Simple Minds Depeche Mode the Human
League new order they clearly have all
these old-school influences but they
bring a kind of fresh indie sensibility
to their songwriting and and that pretty
much allows them to get away with so
many references to the past without
feeling like a direct throwback now when
it comes to song and melody writing hot
chips approach is extremely simple and
consciously so they really try to avoid
complications whenever possible and
instead shoot for an overwhelming sense
of fun
I always thought their vocals could use
a little bit more personality I guess
but they really make up for it for the
most part with so many colourful and
bouncy synthesizers guitars and rhythms
that together just kind of pumped out
grooves that I cannot say no to now
these guys have been improving their
overall sound sound quality production
whatever you want to call it from album
to album with their previous LP
definitely be
hermos were fined instrumentally and
with this new LP Hot Chip is roughly
going for the same sound same approach
lots of layered intricate percussion an
array of synth textures lots of friendly
vocals very quirky attitude and songs
that shoot for a variety of aesthetics
in in dance music and electronica
there's not really a world of change
between this LP and their previous one
the differences are very subtle
maybe this album has more love songs on
it but that's about it
however I'm not trying to say that the
band does not bring variety on this
album sonically at least the song night
and day is a completely unashamed
dancefloor monster that I could see a
band like chromeo covering very
comfortably and the track nice chains is
is very smooth soft and has a beat
behind it that I could see being maybe a
little bit more comfortable playing in
the background of a burial song and the
track look at where we are is one of the
most legit slow jams of 2012 extremely
sexy and the song motion sickness is
such a blissful opener the world is
round the world is and the part where
everything spins I love the lyrics on
this track it's really just a beat
uplifting opener their songs on here
where the backing instrumentation feels
like it's influenced by house music and
disco - especially the closer on here
which I love but maybe slightly goes
overboard with some spoken-word vocals
kind of bordering in territory like I
said there's a variety of songs on this
album I could describe everyone as being
definitely different and distinct from
the others but what I think kind of ties
this entire album together and this is
something that I think Hot Chip has been
getting better at doing with every new
album the band's music just has this
really sweet light innocent feel to it I
could totally put this LP on in front of
a six year old without really breaking a
sweat or a 60 year old for that
mater I'm not trying to insult Hot Chip
or say that it's dumbed down or anything
like that what I'm trying to illustrate
is that I feel the music they make is
just so beautifully universal of course
that kind of direction is going to
warrant some negativity when I put this
album on myself I hated it this is just
not for me this isn't my mood this is my
attitude but the same innocence that was
kind of turning me off at first as I
listen to the album again and again
actually ended up kind of you know
melting the ice and made the album
enjoyable at the end of the day I felt
like a handful of tracks on here were a
little underwhelming and maybe a bit too
heavy-handed with some repetitive
choruses I felt like hot chips for a
into a more dubstep influenced rhythm
was kind of just just okay if you're
looking for a lot of electronic dance
pop songs that are as colorful as the
cover that you're seeing right here then
give this a listen feeling a strong 7 to
a like 8 on this but what did you guys
think of it did you love it did you hate
it
why and what should I review next
anthony Fantan Oh Hot Chip
